rComments: Professor Way is my favorite professor. He's super approachable, if you ask him for help he's always ready to listen. He even printed out the lecture slides for us along with key terms for every single lecture (which are the basis of his exams)! His exams are super fair, the readings aren't dense at all and are so interesting to go through!

Great prof. Passionate and helpful. His slides are clear and easy to follow. Gives list of key terms with each lecture that is basically the exam study guide. The essay is not that tough, although in my experience the TAs that mark are useless and hard to please. Midterm and final are super reasonable as long as you stay on track of your work.

Prof. Way is my favourite professor at UofT!!! He is a really enthusiastic and funny guy. His lectures are always interesting and attractive with clear lecture slides. Although there were reading responses every week, I still enjoyed his class very much.
Great prof, very enthusiastic and great at teaching. Go to lectures because he is a great speaker and you will learn a lot.

Going to lectures is key, not only does he have a lot of information on slides, he takes attendance, so that's some free grades. He does talk a bit too quick sometimes, but he does a good job of explaining the material. He hands out clear outlines for exams/essays so there aren't any surprises, should be easy to get at least a B in his classes
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: He's a good prof. His lecture slides have a lot of info on them so he skips through some, but if you just review them before an exam, you should do fine. His essays are not bad too, just 1200 words and the marking scheme is fair
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: There was a lot of readings that you definitely have to read. He has lecture slides which are available online but they do not come close to covering what is needed to study for exams. His midterm and final is so oddly weighted that getting just a few multiple choice questions wrong will really screw you over. He has a lot of trick questions

He's a great prof. He makes the content very interesting and his lecture slides are very detailed. The only drawback is that he tends to go through them quickly and some classes he may not have time to cover all the slides. I've taken 2 classes with him and enjoyed both

He is a very good professor in general. The slides are with clear logic, and you wont get bored in his class because the topics are attractive and he sometimes speaks in a witty way. Also, the attendance is mandatory since he gives marks on it.

His slides are confusing because he doesn't label them well enough to know what slide corresponds with what topic. Although he's a good professor, the TA's for his classes are extremely hard markers. Tests are weighed heavily b/c they are short ie. I had a midterm where there were only 7 multiple choice questions that were worth 5.7% each.

This is one of those classes where if you have even a little bit of interest in the subject it is easy to love. The prof is very knowledgeable and his lectures are good and usually very entertaining, the course work is manageable and helps you get a good grade. You learn a lot, and its fun.

I took from him a course on Ukrainian politics. He gives readings, but class discussions may become irrelevant to class subject and readings. He speaks of US politics and Africa. If you are not American or have no idea about US politics, you just watch people talking about US politics for hours.
Prof Way helps you to the road towards success. As long as you show that you put in the work and are not stuck up and cocky about how smart you are, you will pass with flying colours

He was a really helpful and clear prof. The only thing that was odd was his exam format where multiple choice questions were way too heavily weighed in relation to the short answer questions. It really could skew the marks.  Just show up and pay attention and you'll do well. Although the TA was very unhelpful and overly hard, he just didnt care.
I like Way.  He structures his lectures well.  I don't like the tutorials and his t.a.'s.  His multiple choice part of exams are tough.  do pay attention to the readings
Easy A if you attend class and do readings, there are no tricks. Attending class is recommended cuz the prof is good and he reviews all the time so the material 'sticks' very easily.
Ok proffessor, you can get good marks if you try hard. Prof. tries way too hard to be funny.
